answers.answer: What?! How did that happen? Is it possible she's just going through a growth slow before a spurt? You've never had that before, have you? And what are they guessing as far as low birth weight?

She's measuring out that she's had nearly 0 growth in the last two weeks. She was slightly behind at the last one but, everyone figured she'd make it up. Even though I'm 30 weeks, she measures 27.  I was totally blind sided. I have no history of this. So I will have another scan in 2 weeks.

Well....hmmm....I guess the only thing you can do is do your best to not worry until that next scan.  Maybe she'll be little, but tough as nails ;)   she'll have to be with all those brothers!  How big were the boys? Mine are all tiny....even when ive tried to pack on weight and bulk them up the biggest was only 6 11.
My smallest was 7lbs 2oz. I'm trying to stay calm. Just really need to stop looking at the info online. Its worse than the not knowing.

Isnt that the truth! I think ive diagnosed myself and all my kids with something we've never even had! Lolseriously though...you're already doing everything that you can possibly do. It stinks to have to just wait it out, but God willing she will pick up some weight here soon.
Thanks tons :) how's things going on your end?

Shastas both my girls had IUGR and they are already expecting this one to have it, because of my history. My first was 5lbs, second was 5lbs9oz. Even though they were small, they were as healthy as any other baby. Never had to go to special care nursery and got to go home on time. Your ob should follow you very closely though. I had 2 ultrasounds and 2 non stress tests every week towards the end. The goal is to get the baby to 38 weeks. Once my babies fell below the 10th percentile, they induced me. My first was induced at 37 weeks, my second at 38 weeks. I was on a sorta bed rest towards the end too with my second. Rest, eat healthy, and try to relax. I know it is stressful, but you will be closely watched. I pray for a healthy baby. If you ever want to talk feel free to contact me.
Thank you so much. It's really good to hear from someone who has been told this and had a good outcome. The stuff you find on the web is scary! Hoping that all is well for you this time too.

We're doing ok. Mom is ok. Still no luck finding a place for her, but everything else is going well, so I cant complain. Its kinda weird logging onto this though and seeing the days click away and think "wait, slow down!"Melissa- that's great to hear good news regarding that. I think after delivery one of my kids (cant remember which) dropped into the 5lb area, but same thing- healthy as can be.
Fingers crossed that you're able to find a place soon. That way you can focus on settling her in while she is transitioning. Then focus on baby. Not try to do both at once. Keep me posted.
I will, for sure. Thanks! Let us all know after the next scan too what the results are.
I'm sorry to hear that I hope things go ok I'm not sure what that is but I hope its nothing to serious.
IUGR stands for intrauterine growth restricted. Thank you for the support. :)

I also had an iugr baby get was 4lbs 12ozs 18inches long and very healthy. His sugar was low and had jaundice so we spent 2 extra days in the hospital. Just ask them to keep an eye on your blood pressure and urine to make sure you don't get preeclampsia. I had to be induced at 35 weeks and from what I've researched iugr in a baby can be a sign. But I also had low amniotic fluid normal but on the low side and at 28 weeks I started gaining 4 to 7lbs a week and sometimes more. The preeclampsia didn't show until the 35th week.I was scared through out my whole pregnancy. I was told he was going to have clubbed hands and feet. At one point they thought he had Downs but found out they tested to early because they went by my last menstrual an of course I'm one of those irregular and ovulate a lot later. He was 3 weeks earlier than they thought. By the way his hands nor feet were clubbed.I did notice that he gained weight very quickly. He did stay in the 10th percentile for a long time but at 12 months they said he went in to the 25th. Iugr babies may be tiny but they sure are fighters and very strong. Don't worry and just drink lots of water eat healthy and stay away from fast food If you can. And also leave caffeine alone because I've read caffeine can stunt a baby's growth.  Well too much caffeine.
It is going to be ok. Dont read all the stuff on the internet, it is just going to stress you out. Stay positive. *hugs* Im sure shes going to be fine.

I'm wondering if this is caused by the second placenta...I have that spare placenta in there. Idk if that has something to do with it. But anyway. Thank you to everyone who has responded to my post. I am so blessed to have found this community. There are some truly amazing people.

I agree with bbm, don't read all the stuff on the internet. Relax, relax, relax. My doctor told me the IUGR for me is caused by my placenta not adequately nourishing the baby in the end. Baby2014 is right too, the baby may be small but they are strong fighters, both my girls were small for the first two years but are in the 30th percentiles now. Another thing your doctor may opt to have during delivery is having the special care team in the room. They were there for both my deliveries, luckily we hardly needed them. Like I said relax, eat healthy, and enjoy the remainder of your pregnancy. I'm only 14 weeks, so I have a long road ahead of me. Our IUGR babies will be perfect though!

Shastas84 your new princess will be just fine!!! Like you said  if it's not 1 thing its another. Try and not stress about it and not trying to go religious on you but put it in God's hands and trust in him and let go of the worry. And most importantly STAY OFF THE INTERNET looking up info. I know you want to be knowledgeable about it but it will scare you and drive you insane!! I know trust me! Like to drove myself crazy when I was given not so good news about my princess. Your 1of the most positive and kind hearted person that I know on here. Shastas stay positive for Shastas!! She'll be just fine!! ;)

You are all so awesome. Thank you so much for all of the positive responses. And the amazing support. I am so grateful for each kind word you have shared and each of the stories that have been shared. You're the kindest sweetest people. And even though I know we have never met, I count you amongst my true friends.

question: So, I went to my dr appt today. She wasn't going to do an ultrasound this time since I had one just two weeks ago. But she was measuring my belly and then listening to the baby's heart & looked at my chart. Then she measures again... I started getting nervous right there. She said that my fundel height is 3 weeks behind. So she sends me to u/s. Well now I have been told the baby is growth restricted. She was diagnosed with IUGR. So I am now high risk because of this. And have been told to expect her to be a low birth weight baby. :'(
title: If it's not one thing....
